title: mis-spelt non-link URL http://godashboard.appspot.com/packages in goinstall documentation page
body:
by **ehog.hedge**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. go to http://golang.org/cmd/goinstall/
2. note that the first paragraph says

 Goinstall is an experiment in automatic package installation.
 It installs  packages, possibly downloading them from the internet. 
 It maintains a list of public Go packages at 
 http://godashboard.appspot.com/packages

3. try to click the URL. Nothing happens; it's not a link.

4. cut-and-paste the URL into the browser address bar. Go there.

Expected page: the Go packages page.

Instead: a completely blank page. No body, no head, no html, nothing.

The goinstall page should have the appspot URL say "package" not
"packages", OR the dashboard "package" should be renamed
"packages".
(There's multiple packages, so I'd argue for the latter change.)

The URL should be a clickable link.

Chris
